transcript.title: TRANSCRIPT OF THE PRIME MINISTER THE HON JOHN HOWARD MP ADDRESS AT SNOWY MOUNTAINS 50TH ANNIVERSARY CELEBRATIONS, JINDABYNE NSW
transcript.content:
E&OE..................

Well thank you very much Mr Charlton. Janette and I are delighted to share

this tremendous celebration which commemorates the commencement of what

must rank as one of the greatest achievements of the history of the Australian

nation. The Snowy Mountains Scheme was a phenomenal engineering achievement,

and it has done an enormous amount to help and build the modern Australia.

But even more importantly than that the Snowy Mountains Scheme was an amazing

Australian achievement in bringing people together and binding them into

one mighty Australian workforce. And as I moved through the crowd today,

it's a reminder to me of the incredible range of nationalities, of ethnicities,

of people of different cultures, of different language, many of whom may

have had the odd argument with each other before they came to Australia,

but once they came to Australia they all found in this new welcoming tolerant

country a new homeland. And I want to say on behalf of that country, from

the bottom of our hearts, how immensely grateful we are to the men and women

of the Snowy who gave us this wonderful national achievement.

In so many different ways you taught us different cultures, different habits,

and they've all now become part of the great Australian mainstream. So can

I say on behalf of the Government, can I say on behalf of all of the people

of Australia, that we are immensely proud of the engineering achievement

which is the Snowy River Scheme. We are immensely proud of the national

development achievement which is the Snowy River Scheme. But even more importantly

than that we are immensely proud of the human achievement which is represented

by the Snowy River Scheme. And today which must rank probably as the biggest

family reunion ever staged in Australia, certainly the biggest family reunion

that I've ever been to, I simply want to say to all of you, we are immensely

proud of what you did, we are grateful for your commitment, we remember

those who suffered and those who lost their lives in the construction at

various stages of the Snowy Scheme. We remember the vision of those people

who put the scheme together more than 50 years ago. And it is a marvelous

opportunity under this beautiful Australian sun to celebrate 50 years of

the commencement of the Snowy Scheme, and all of the great cultural diversity

that the Snowy Scheme helped to bring to the modern Australia. A million

thanks to all of you.

[Ends]
